properties.name: success
properties.summary: Indicates if the user was logged in successfully. Returns true if request succeeded, false otherwise.

properties.name: cancelled
properties.summary: Indicates if the user canceled the login request by closing the dialog.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: Error message, if any returned. Will be undefined if success is true.

properties.name: code
properties.summary: Error code. Error code will be 0 if success is true, nonzero otherwise. If the error was generated by the operating system, that system's error value is used. Otherwise, this value will be -1.

properties.name: uid
properties.summary: User ID returned by Facebook if the login was successful.

properties.name: data
properties.summary: Data returned by Facebook when we query for the UID (using graph path "me") after a successful login. Data is in JSON format, and includes information such as user name, locale and gender.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: requestDialogCompleted
events.summary: Fired when the Send Request dialog is closed.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: Returns true if request succeeded, false otherwise.

properties.name: cancelled
properties.summary: Indicates if the user canceled the request by closing the dialog.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: Error message, if any returned. Will be undefined if success is true.

properties.name: data
properties.summary: data returned by Facebook. See Facebook reference for details.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: shareCompleted
events.summary: Fired when the Share dialog or Web Share dialog is closed.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: Returns true if request succeeded, false otherwise.

properties.name: cancelled
properties.summary: Indicates if the user canceled the request by closing the dialog.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: Error message, if any returned. Will be undefined if success is true.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: inviteCompleted
events.summary: Fired when the Invite dialog is closed.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: Returns true if request succeeded, false otherwise.

properties.name: cancelled
properties.summary: Indicates if the user canceled the request by closing the dialog.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: Error message, if any returned. Will be undefined if success is true.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

methods.name: authorize
methods.summary: Prompts the user to log in (if not already logged in) and authorize your application. You can also use Modules.Facebook.LoginButton to log in.
methods.description:
Be sure to set your required permissions before calling authorize.

A login event is generated to indicate a successful or unsuccessful login attempt.

# iOS Platform Notes

On iOS, do not request any write permissions before calling this method. Use the requestNewPublishPermissions to request write permissions once the user authorizes the application.

# Prior to Release 4.0.0

Set the appid property as well as the permissions property before calling authorize().

methods.name: createActivityWorker
methods.summary: Creates a Facebook proxy to hook into the activity of either a standalone Titanium.UI.Window (not inside a TabGroup) or Titanium.UI.TabGroup.
methods.description:
Set the lifecycleContainer property in the dictionary passed to the method to either the current active instance of a Titanium.UI.Window or Titanium.UI.TabGroup in order to monitor the activity's lifecycle events, required by Facebook to synchronize its state between various activities in the application.

The proxy object must be created before calling the open() method on the associated Window or TabGroup.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary:
Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by Titanium.Proxy except those marked not-creation or read-only.

Note: You must set the lifecycleContainer property.

methods.name: createLikeButton

deprecated.notes: The API was removed by the Facebook SDK 4.x and up.

methods.summary: Creates and returns an instance of Modules.Facebook.LikeButton.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by Modules.Facebook.LikeButton except those marked not-creation or read-only.

methods.name: createLoginButton
methods.summary: Creates and returns an instance of Modules.Facebook.LoginButton.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by Modules.Facebook.LoginButton except those marked not-creation or read-only.

methods.name: createMessengerButton

deprecated.notes: This API was removed to align with the removal of the Facebook SDK 5+.

methods.summary: Creates and returns an instance of Modules.Facebook.MessengerButton.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by Modules.Facebook.MessengerButton except those marked not-creation or read-only.

methods.name: fetchDeferredAppLink
methods.summary: Fetch the deferred app link
methods.description: Deferred deep linking allows you to send people to a custom view after they installed your app via the app store.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback to invoke when the request completes.

methods.name: fetchNearbyPlacesForCurrentLocation
methods.summary: Query for places the device is likely located in.
methods.description:
This is an asynchronous call, due to the need to fetch the current location from the device. Note that the results of the graph request are improved if the user has both Wi-Fi and Bluetooth enabled.

Note: Remember to request the location permssions with Titanium.Geolocation and include either the NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription or the NSLocationAlwaysUsageDescription key in your plist before using this method. The Facebook graph also requires the FacebookClientToken to be present in the plist, so check the Facebook Developer Portal > Apps > Your App > Settings > Advanced for your OAuth client-token.

parameters.name: confidenceLevel
parameters.summary: The Minimum Confidence level place estimate candidates must meet.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.summary: A list of fields that you might want the request to return. See the Facebook docs for all possible values.

parameters.name: success
parameters.summary: The callback triggered when places are successfully fetched.

parameters.name: error
parameters.summary: The callback triggered when places could not be fetched.

methods.name: fetchNearbyPlacesForSearchTearm
methods.summary: Query for nearby places using the device's current location and search-term.
methods.description:
This is an asynchronous call, due to the need to fetch the current location from the device.

Note: Remember to request the location permssions with Titanium.Geolocation and include either the NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription or the NSLocationAlwaysUsageDescription key in your plist before using this method. The Facebook graph also requires the FacebookClientToken to be present in the plist, so check the Facebook Developer Portal > Apps > Your App > Settings > Advanced for your OAuth client-token.

parameters.name: searchTearm
parameters.summary: The term to search for in the Places Graph.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.summary: The categories for the place. Each string in this array must be a category recognized by the SDK. See the Facebook Docs for all possible values.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.summary: A list of fields that you might want the request to return. See the Facebook docs for all possible values.

parameters.name: distance
parameters.summary: The search radius. For an unlimited radius, use 0.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.summary: A pagination cursor.

parameters.name: success
parameters.summary: The callback triggered when places are successfully fetched.

parameters.name: error
parameters.summary: The callback triggered when places could not be fetched.

methods.name: initialize
methods.summary: Loads a cached Facebook session if available, then fires the login event.
methods.description:
Be sure to set your login and logout event listeners before calling initialize.

**Note: This method needs to be called before calling authorize in order to be handle the auth-flow correctly. Otherwise, you might see a white screen without any response.

The timeout parameter was deprecated in version 5.0.0 of Ti.Facebook and is not used anymore.

methods.name: logCustomEvent
methods.summary: Logs a custom event to Facebook.
methods.description:
From the Facebook API Reference:

Events are not sent immediately when logged. They're cached and flushed out to the Facebook servers in a number of situations:

  • when an event count threshold is passed (currently 100 logged events).
  • when a time threshold is passed (currently 15 seconds).
  • when an app has gone to background and is then brought back to the foreground.

Some things to note when logging events:

  • There is a limit on the number of unique event names an app can use, on the order of 300.
  • Event names must be between 2 and 40 characters and must consist of alphanumeric characters, _, - or spaces.

parameters.name: event
parameters.summary: Arbitrary string to log as an event.

parameters.name: valueToSum
parameters.summary: An arbitrary number that can represent any value (e.g., a price or a quantity). When reported, all of the valueToSum properties will be summed together in Facebook Analytics for Apps (since 5.4.0).

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: A dictionary object containing optional parameters (since 5.4.0).

methods.name: logout
methods.summary: Clears the OAuth accessToken and logs out the user.

methods.name: logPurchase
methods.summary: Log a purchase of the specified amount, in the specified currency.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.summary: Purchase amount to be logged, as expressed in the specified currency. This value will be rounded to the thousandths place (e.g., 12.34567 becomes 12.346).

parameters.name: currency
parameters.summary: Currency, is denoted as, e.g. "USD", "EUR", "GBP". See ISO-4217 for specific values.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: A dictionary object containing optional parameters (since 8.0.0 in android and since 7.0.0 in ios).

methods.name: logPushNotificationOpen
methods.summary: Log an app event that tracks that the application was open via Push Notification.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.summary: Notification payload received via in the push-notification callback.

parameters.name: action
parameters.summary: Name of the action that was taken.

methods.name: presentMessengerDialog
methods.summary: Opens a supported Messenger dialog from the Facebook Messenger App.
methods.description:
Be sure to check if the device can support this method by calling canOpenURL with "fb-messenger-api://" before using this method. If true, you can use this method. If false, the Facebook Messenger application is probably not installed in the device.

Listen for the shareCompleted to be notified if the attempt was successful or not.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: A dictionary object containing optional parameters.

methods.name: presentPhotoShareDialog
methods.summary: Opens a Facebook photo share dialog.
methods.description:
Note: The images parameter is required by the Facebook SDK.

Android Note: In order to share images on Android, the Facebook app needs to be installed and the "content provider" settings in your Android manifest needs to be configured:

<provider android:name="com.facebook.FacebookContentProvider"
          android:authorities="com.facebook.app.FacebookContentProvider<YOUR_APP_ID>"
          android:exported="true" />

Listen for the shareCompleted to be notified if the attempt was successful or not.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: A dictionary object containing the required and optional parameters.

methods.name: presentSendRequestDialog
methods.summary: Opens an App Request dialog.
methods.description: A requestDialogCompleted event is generated to indicate if the request attempt was successful or unsuccessful, and the resultURL.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: A dictionary object containing parameters.

methods.name: presentShareDialog
methods.summary: Opens a Facebook link share dialog.
methods.description:
Note: The link parameter is required by the Facebook SDK.

Listen for the shareCompleted to be notified if the attempt was successful or not.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: A dictionary object containing the required and optional parameters.

methods.name: refreshPermissionsFromServer
methods.summary: Makes a request to Facebook to get the latest permissions granted.
methods.description:
Facebook now grants total control over granted permissions, and if the user modified the permissions outside of your app your cached token may not be updated.

Listen for the tokenUpdated event to be notified if the attempt was successful.

methods.name: requestNewPublishPermissions

deprecated.notes: Request all permissions via the permissions property before calling authorize.

methods.summary: Makes a request to Facebook for additional write permissions.
methods.description: Note that it is not an error for the user to 'Skip' your requested permissions, so you should check the module's permissions property following the call.

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.summary: Array of additional permissions to request. For a complete list of permissions, see the official Facebook Permissions Reference

parameters.name: audience
parameters.summary: The extent of the visibility write permissions will have.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback to invoke when the request completes.

methods.name: requestNewReadPermissions

deprecated.notes: Request all permissions via the permissions property before calling authorize.

methods.summary: Makes a request to Facebook for additional read permissions.
methods.description: Note that it is not an error for the user to 'Skip' your requested permissions, so you should check the module's permissions property following the call.

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.summary: Array of additional permissions to request. For a complete list of permissions, see the official Facebook Permissions Reference

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback to invoke when the request completes.

methods.name: requestWithGraphPath
methods.summary: Makes a Facebook Graph API request.
methods.description:
If the request requires user authorization, the user must be logged in, and your app must be authorized to make the request. You can check the loggedIn property to determine if the user is logged in.

Every Facebook object has an associated path. For example, "me" requests information about the current user.

For a complete list of Graph API methods, parameters and return types, see the official Facebook Graph API documentation.

parameters.name: path
parameters.summary: Graph API path to request.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: A dictionary object for setting parameters required by the call, if any.

parameters.name: httpMethod
parameters.summary: The HTTP method (GET/POST/DELETE) to use for the call.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback to invoke when the request completes.

methods.name: setCurrentAccessToken
methods.summary: Set a new access token for using Facebook services.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary:
A dictionary object containing required and optional parameters.

Note: There is an open issue in the native Facebook SDK causing the appID from not being updated although specified in the parameters. You can use the appID setter to change the appID inside your app.

methods.name: setPushNotificationsDeviceToken
methods.summary: Sets a device token to register the current application installation for push notifications.

parameters.name: deviceToken
parameters.summary: Device-token received when registering for push-notifications.

methods.name: shareMediaToMessenger
methods.summary: Call this method to open Messenger and share an image, animated GIF or video.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: A dictionary object containing required and optional parameters.

properties.name: accessToken
properties.summary: OAuth token set after a successful authorize.

properties.name: accessTokenActive
properties.summary: Returns true if the accessToken is not null AND not expired.

properties.name: accessTokenExpired
properties.summary: Returns whether the accessToken is expired by checking its expirationDate property.

properties.name: appID
properties.summary:
If not explicitly set, the default will be read from the application's plist (FacebookAppID) which is the recommended way.

Since Titanium SDK 6.2.0, this property also has a getter to return the currently set appID.

properties.name: canPresentOpenGraphActionDialog
properties.summary: Checks if the device can support the use of the Facebook Open Graph action dialog from the Facebook App.

properties.name: expirationDate
properties.summary: Time at which the accessToken expires.

properties.name: loggedIn
properties.summary: Indicates if the user is logged in.

properties.name: loginBehavior
properties.summary: Defines the behavior that the module will attempt to use for authorize().
properties.description: Be sure to set this before calling authorize if this is needed. It is recommended to follow Facebook's guidelines for ideal login behavior. Defaults to Titanium.Modules.Facebook.LOGIN_BEHAVIOR_NATIVE_WITH_FALLBACK on Android and Titanium.Modules.Facebook.LOGIN_BEHAVIOR_BROWSER on iOS (which uses the native Safari Dialog internally).

properties.name: permissions
properties.summary: Array of permissions to request for your app.
properties.description:
Be sure the permissions you want are set before calling authorize.

For a complete list of permissions, see the official Facebook Permissions Reference

# iOS Platform Notes

On iOS, do not request any write permissions before calling the authorize() method. Use the requestNewPublishPermissions to request write permissions once the user authorizes the application.

Prior to Release 4.0.0

To use the build-in iOS 6 login, this property cannot contain any of the following: offline_access, publish_actions, publish_stream, publish_checkins, ads_management, create_event, rsvp_event, manage_friendlists, manage_notifications, or manage_pages.

properties.name: uid
properties.summary: Unique user ID returned from Facebook.

constants.name: ACTION_TYPE_ASK_FOR
constants.summary: The user is asking for an object from friends.

constants.name: ACTION_TYPE_NONE
constants.summary: No action type.

constants.name: ACTION_TYPE_SEND
constants.summary: The user is sending an object to the friends.

constants.name: ACTION_TYPE_TURN
constants.summary: It is the turn of the friends to play against the user in a match.

constants.name: AUDIENCE_EVERYONE
constants.summary: Published content is visible to all Facebook users.
constants.description: Use to set the default audience with either audience or requestNewPublishPermissions.

constants.name: AUDIENCE_FRIENDS
constants.summary: Published content is only visible to the user and user's friends.
constants.description: Use to set the default audience with either audience or requestNewPublishPermissions.

constants.name: AUDIENCE_ONLY_ME
constants.summary: Published content is only visible to the user.
constants.description: Use to set the default audience with either audience or requestNewPublishPermissions.

constants.name: EVENT_NAME_ADDED_PAYMENT_INFO
constants.summary: Log this event when the user has entered their payment info.

constants.name: EVENT_NAME_ADDED_TO_CART
constants.summary: Log this event when the user has added an item to their cart.

constants.name: EVENT_NAME_COMPLETED_REGISTRATION
constants.summary: Log this event when a user has completed registration with the app.

constants.name: EVENT_NAME_INITIATED_CHECKOUT
constants.summary: Log this event when the user has entered the checkout process.

constants.name: EVENT_NAME_VIEWED_CONTENT
constants.summary: Log this event when a user has viewed a form of content in the app.

constants.name: EVENT_PARAM_CONTENT
constants.summary: Parameter key used to specify data for the one or more pieces of content being logged about.

constants.name: EVENT_PARAM_CONTENT_ID
constants.summary: Parameter key used to specify an ID for the specific piece of content being logged about.

constants.name: EVENT_PARAM_CONTENT_TYPE
constants.summary: Parameter key used to specify a generic content type/family for the logged event.

constants.name: EVENT_PARAM_CURRENCY
constants.summary: Parameter key used to specify currency used with logged event.

constants.name: EVENT_PARAM_NUM_ITEMS
constants.summary: Parameter key used to specify how many items are being processed.

constants.name: EVENT_PARAM_PAYMENT_INFO_AVAILABLE
constants.summary: Parameter key used to specify whether payment info is available.

constants.name: FILTER_APP_NON_USERS
constants.summary: Friends not using the app can be displayed.

constants.name: FILTER_APP_USERS
constants.summary: Friends using the app can be displayed.

constants.name: FILTER_NONE
constants.summary: No filter all friends can be displayed.

constants.name: LOGIN_BEHAVIOR_BROWSER
constants.summary: Opens login window in the default Web Browser (Safari/Firefox etc...)

constants.name: LOGIN_BEHAVIOR_DEVICE_AUTH
constants.summary: Expose Facebook Login for devices such as Android TV and Fire TV.

constants.name: LOGIN_BEHAVIOR_NATIVE
constants.summary:
Opens login window with the native Facebook app. On iOS it will attempt to fallback to <Titanium.Modules.Facebook.LOGIN_BEHAVIOR_BROWSER> if the Facebook app is not installed or Facebook chooses it internally. For Android use <Titanium.Modules.Facebook.LOGIN_BEHAVIOR_NATIVE_WITH_FALLBACK> to get this behavior.

Note: As of today (Facebook SDK 4.11.0), Facebook seems to not allow logging in using the Facebook app to login, so this constant won't work proper on iOS. This issue is discussed here.

constants.name: LOGIN_BEHAVIOR_NATIVE_WITH_FALLBACK
constants.summary: Opens login window with the native Facebook app. On Android it will attempt to fallback to <Titanium.Modules.Facebook.LOGIN_BEHAVIOR_BROWSER> if the Facebook app is not installed. For iOS use <Titanium.Modules.Facebook.NATIVE> to get this behavior.

constants.name: LOGIN_BEHAVIOR_SYSTEM_ACCOUNT
constants.summary: Attempts to login with through the Facebook account currently signed in through Settings.

constants.name: LOGIN_BEHAVIOR_WEB
constants.summary: Opens login window through a modal browser window.

constants.name: LOGIN_BUTTON_TOOLTIP_BEHAVIOR_AUTOMATIC
constants.summary: The default behavior. The tooltip will only be displayed if the app is eligible (determined by possible server round trip).

constants.name: LOGIN_BUTTON_TOOLTIP_BEHAVIOR_DISABLE
constants.summary: Force disable. In this case you can still exert more refined control by manually constructing a new login button.

constants.name: LOGIN_BUTTON_TOOLTIP_BEHAVIOR_FORCE_DISPLAY
constants.summary: Force display of the tooltip (typically for UI testing).

constants.name: LOGIN_BUTTON_TOOLTIP_STYLE_FRIENDLY_BLUE
constants.summary: Light blue background, white text, faded blue close button.

constants.name: LOGIN_BUTTON_TOOLTIP_STYLE_NEUTRAL_GRAY
constants.summary: Dark gray background, white text, light gray close button.

constants.name: MESSENGER_BUTTON_MODE_CIRCULAR
constants.summary: Use with mode to specify the default send button reading "Send".
constants.description: You can localize the button by localizing "Send" in your strings.xml. Learn more about that topic here.

constants.name: MESSENGER_BUTTON_MODE_RECTANGULAR
constants.summary: Use with mode to specify the default send button reading "Send".
constants.description: You can localize the button by localizing "Send" in your strings.xml. Learn more about that topic here.

constants.name: MESSENGER_BUTTON_STYLE_BLUE
constants.summary: Use with style to specify the default send button style.

constants.name: MESSENGER_BUTTON_STYLE_WHITE
constants.summary: Use with style to specify the default send button style.

constants.name: MESSENGER_BUTTON_STYLE_WHITE_BORDERED
constants.summary: Use with style to specify the default send button style.

constants.name: PLACE_LOCATION_CONFIDENCE_HIGH
constants.summary: High confidence level.

constants.name: PLACE_LOCATION_CONFIDENCE_LOW
constants.summary: Low confidence level.

constants.name: PLACE_LOCATION_CONFIDENCE_MEDIUM
constants.summary: Medium confidence level.

constants.name: PLACE_LOCATION_CONFIDENCE_NOT_APPLICABLE
constants.summary: Used to indicate that any level is acceptable as a minimum threshold.

constants.name: SHARE_DIALOG_MODE_AUTOMATIC
constants.summary: Acts with the most appropriate mode that is available.

constants.name: SHARE_DIALOG_MODE_BROWSER
constants.summary: Displays the dialog in Safari.

constants.name: SHARE_DIALOG_MODE_FEED_BROWSER
constants.summary: Displays the feed dialog in Safari.

constants.name: SHARE_DIALOG_MODE_FEED_WEB
constants.summary: Displays the feed dialog in a webview within the app.

constants.name: SHARE_DIALOG_MODE_NATIVE
constants.summary: Displays the dialog in the main native Facebook app.

constants.name: SHARE_DIALOG_MODE_SHARE_SHEET
constants.summary: Displays the dialog in the iOS integrated share sheet.

constants.name: SHARE_DIALOG_MODE_WEB
constants.summary: Displays the dialog in a web view within the app.
